document_title: What is stillbirth? Signs and causes of stillbirth
subsection_content:
The following symptoms may be signs of stillbirth for timely treatment:
No more fetal movements: After the 20th week of pregnancy, the fetus begins to move, and the mother is the one who feels the fetal movements most clearly. If suddenly one day, the mother no longer sees the baby in her womb, it is very likely that the fetus died in the mother's uterus.; Uterine height does not increase, or even decreases: At each regular prenatal examination, the mother will have the doctor measure the height of the uterus. This measurement will increase proportionally to the gestational age. But if this index does not change or decreases, you need to check your pregnancy immediately.; Reduced bust size: Breast engorgement and milk secretion is a common phenomenon in most pregnant women. If this phenomenon suddenly disappears, it may be a sign that you need to have a pregnancy test.; Bleeding or dark vaginal discharge accompanied by loss of appetite, nausea, dizziness, back pain, high fever, general fatigue...
subsection_title: thai luu.json. Recognize the signs of stillbirth
subsection_data:
